text: Alright then, rules are simple. If you get picked, you pick either Truth or Dare.
After you finish, you get to pick somebody else.
We go like that until food's done.
Those are a hassle. Just issue new questions or challenges until the other person complies.
I dare you to lift Jamie with one hand!
...you just wanted to ask me something right? Okay then. Truth.
Did you or did you not have a brief stint as bodyguard to a certain Madame Laverne six years ago?
I don't think so. I don't even know any Madame Laverne.
Alright, that's one possibility off the list.
No, I'm the one that dares you.
Are those things on your head your ears?
Is there anything you have rejected from clients?
Those who want to roleplay with mutilation.
I mean sure, I can take off my limbs with no problem. I have to do that for maintenance every now and again.
But I'm not okay with doing it for clients. Because first: that leaves me defenseless, which I cannot allow by any means.
And second: Half of the time, the roleplay involves a violent scenario.
And there are some behaviours I won't reinforce, namely non-consensual violence of any kind.
Okay, I want you to say in the most sultry voice you can muster: "admin override".
Seems you caused some collateral damage here.
I-I don't know what you're talking about.
Yeah, whatever. I want you to bark.
I asked you to do it. Not to say it.
Hey! If I bark, then I'm the king of the bar! 'cause I'm barking!
Yeah, yeah. I have a lame sense of humor. Whatever.
Okay... why are your nails so thin?
Your nails! You won't be able to dig with such flimsy nails!
Um... all humans have nails like these.
Why are you so reluctant to pet him?
I dare you to go out and stay there.
Well, why don't you continue in the dog's place, Dorothy.
I dare you, Dana, to pick up honey and carry her like a bride!
"How can a clam cram in a clean cream can?"
It's a tongue twister. Say it.
"How can a clam cram in a clean cream can?"
"How can a clam cram in a clean cream can?" "How can a clam cram in a clean cream can?"
You make it seem so easy...
"How can a clam cram in a crean-..." Agh!
(Wait, Lilim get confused by tongue twisters?)
What's the most uncomfortable thing that has happened to those arms of yours?
They get stuck a lot on clothes and fibers. Sometimes the joints get jammed with cloth.
Just how much of those arms are mechanical, anyway?
Less than you think. The only things I truly lost were my hands.
The arm muscles are still mine, albeit with some enhancements.
And my skin doesn't grow on them. They're covered by the plates.
It's more an enhancement than a replacement, really.
Hm... Use an Argentine Backbreaker on Nick.
Does the name Joseph Valentine ring any bells?
I know of a Joseph Shine, but not Valentine.
Hey, Chief. Can you drop me?
Yes! Come on! Pet me harder! Is that all you've got?!
Okay then, Gil. What do you pick?
Try to make a Sugar Rush with your eyes closed.
No, I'm the one that dares you.
Alright! You, the blonde. Pet me.
Colder than your usual hands, I guess.
My grandpa taught me how years ago.
How old were you when your grandpa died?
14 or so, if memory serves right.
Sorry. Need to use the bathroom.
Jill... what did that massage do exactly?
It was a regular massage. I might have accidentally unclasped her bra though.
Well, just imagine the pressure the poor thing must be a subject to.
You have a pretty triumphant look on your face though.
If everyone's done talking about my bra, let's move on.
(I wonder how long until the food is done.)
How did you get your arm?
Lift Gil by the neck of his shirt.
I guess. Who cares? I didn't hear about your arm.
Alright, Gil. Now that I have you in this position, answer me.
You're in no position to pick! Now answer!
Did you live in Scotland for two years?
I guess that rules out a couple of possibilities...
What? Oh right, I'm still lifting you. Sorry.
Oh! Oh! I have a suggestion!
Hm... how strong are those arms of yours?
It's still my muscles under them so... not very.
Although not having fleshy skin makes things easier.
I just wanted to make sure.
I dare you to break this nut with your hands.
Holy shit, Gil. Are you really into that?
Asking a woman to break a nut in her hands and then watching her eat it, does that turn you on?
Wait, wait... is this an actual thing that turns guys on? I need to know for professional reasons.
Gil-... wait, that was close this time.
Okay then. What's your most embarrassing childhood dream?
For example: when I was a girl I wanted to be a "Professional Puzzle Master".
I guess, in a way, I accomplished that, but you understand.
I wanted to be a... ventriloquist.
When I was a child, I liked this show called Lucia's Fun House.
The one with the woman in the house with the talking stuff?
My parents divorced when I was around... six, I think.
Mom was on tour with an orchestra and my dad was working constantly.
I spent a lot of time with my grandpa, but he slept a lot, so I was on my own most of the time.
I liked to pretend things like chairs or beds could talk. And since AI wasn't so advanced back then...
Anyway, I went to a magic show once, and there was this guy making a puppet talk.
My dad told me he was a "ventriloquist" so I kinda obsessed about wanting to be one.
Even today, I'd be lying if I said that I don't think about it every now and then.
So that's why you pretend Fore can talk.
Okay, I want you to put your leg behind your head.
So, the extra-flexible joints weren't just a bluff.
I'm pretty sure I heard something rip though.
I dare you to stare honey straight in the eyes for ten seconds.
Chase your tail... but only make three spins. No more, no less.
I dare you to call me a good boy!
Have you ever heard of the Unicorn Gang?
Ah, yeah. The person that got me into Glitch City is part of it, actually.
Dammit, that makes me backtrack a bit.
You're just spinning yourself on the chair.
That's not what I had in mind.
Then be more specific next time.
I dare you to go out and stay there.
Well, then. Why don't you continue in the dog's place, Dorothy?
Hey, sweater pups. What do you pick?
I dare you to put on some twintails!
Hey Jill, lend me your hair ties for a second.
I haven't worn twintails since elementary school, now that I think about it.
Alright, let me untie them. Too breezy for my taste.
If you had to spend two hours in a pressurization chamber with someone, who would you pick?
Out of what pool of people?
I guess either you or Jamie.
Yeah, I mean. If I went into a chamber with Dorothy, it'd be... fishy.
I know for certain that my Boss would fall asleep because she gets bored easily.
What's the most embarrassing thing that has happened to your arms?
There was this one time when I got mugged on the street so I... uh...
I... kinda threw my hand at the thief to knock him out.
I think it's what you usually call a... rocket punch?
So you didn't throw it so much as it... propelled itself towards the thief.
It was just so cartoony! It's a bit embarrassing.
It's a bit impractical too. The hand has a startup time after reattachment.
Yes, but... why add such a function?
Why WOULDN'T you add such a function?
Boss, don't tell your arm can also...
This hand of mine is awesome!
How do you manage to keep that stubble of yours at the same length all the time?
I mean, no matter when I come here, whether it's at 3AM on a weekday or in the afternoon on Sunday, you always have the same three day beard.
It never gets any longer, but you also never shave. How the hell do you do that?!
Now that I think about it...
I do shave, but... I use an electric razor.
And set it quite low, so...
You're not saying something. But whatever.
This is something I've been meaning to ask for a long time.
Why is the bar called Valhalla if your designation is "VA-11"? Shouldn't it be "VA-1"?
It WAS going to be that.
When I applied for a bar owner certification through the BTC, Brian told me I would have the VA-1 code.
BUT then came this one guy, and he pulled some strings to get a certification faster.
He took MY position and I told Brian to hold off until the VA-11 code became available.
This bar remained closed for five months longer than it should have been.
What kind of monster takes the chance for a pun from someone?!
Now I need something to cheer myself up.
Hey Jill, I dare you to make this glass "talk."
Oi! Whatcha lookin' at mate? Imma hook ya in yer gabber.
Hey J, I dare you to bury me.
I was joking! Joking! Don't bury me for reals! I'm alive!
Okay then, Gil. Pick your poison.
How did you get into the city? How did you end up here of all places?
To be honest... I just wandered aimlessly for some time.
Stuff happened and I went from place to place.
Eventually, I came across the city and stumbled upon the bar.
Try reading that sign without your glasses.
"For... rela... xing times, make it sun... "
So you can see without them?
I'm not blind. Just mildly uncomfortable without my glasses.
Try to undo that bed hair of yours.
Yeah, you know, that one bit of hair that's always protruding.
I have no idea what you're saying.
Maybe if I split it... it rejoined on its own?!
That ahoge is like my willpower.
What would you do if Fore was a girl AND pregnant?
I mean, you educate them and give them the tools, but it's up to them in the end.
I'd just make sure she was able to cope with it.
I'd only call myself a failure if it was the result of personal irresponsibility.
But if it's her choice or if she's at least able to take responsibility, then I can only support her.
After all, she didn't kill someone, she's bringing a new life into this world.
...Jill, it's a hypothetical scenario. And it's a cat.
It might be Tom, it might be James, it might be something else. But I'm not revealing it!
What I CAN tell you is that my name is-...
What if he's called Tom James?
Okay then, who's YOUR owner, G?
*sigh* Whatever. You take it from here, Jill.
Can you lift me with just your non-mechanical arm?
Alright, you can. You can! Please put me down!
Well then. Hey Gil, Truth or Dare?
Okay then. Please cross your arms.
Now turn a bit to the left...
A bit more... and now stand still for a second.
Nope, not even same race. Sorry for the trouble.
You were comparing me to a pic?!
Can I at least see it?
Because I can remove my head with no problem.
Do you want me to remove my head?
I'll pass. I take your word for it.
I do, but... I'm not gonna be the party pooper here.
Fiiiiiiiiine. I guess it's my turn now.
Hey Dana. What do you pick?
If you had to marry honey OR John, who would you pick?
I mean she's cute, she's smart...
...and I kinda own Gil anyways, so it's kinda redundant.
Speaking of Gil. Truth or Truth, fuckboy?
It's one of those things I can't remember or was never informed about.
Strangely, I do remember an early childhood in the Arctic of all places.
I dare you to go out and stay there.
Well then, I'll take the next turn.
You're a hacker, right? I dare you to hack a cute pic of Jill out of her phone.
I have old pics, cat pics, selfies. Pick one.
Jill's phone is a CaliCOMP. They get updates more than any other system in the world.
I've made it a weekly ritual to update my CaliCOMP hack program and she's my guinea pig.
I hack into it once a week. And since she takes daily pics, I just take one for that week.
If I'm missing a week, I just look for the missing pic and investigate.
...you guys do know I'm still here, right?
Then I dare you to call Gil by his real name.
Of course I can. But messing with Dilbert is more fun.
Well then, Dorothy. Truth or Dare?
Do you have any dreams you'd want to eventually fulfill?
Well, this might sound silly but... I wanna work with kids.
I have a friend that works in an orphanage. I help her from time to time.
And I find it so much fun to work with kids. I can't explain why...
If I had to pick another job or think of something I want to eventually try, that would be it.
Teacher, nurse, pediatrician. Something like that.
That wasn't an answer I expected.
I dare you to say something nice about all of us playing.
You are a pretty cheerful girl, Dorothy.
Chief... well, I pretty much owe you everything for giving my life any semblance of order.
Alma... you can be a really caring person.
And Jill... you're a pretty smart girl.
So, is nobody gonna say anything nice about him in return?
What is there to say? He's one of the nicest and most responsible guys I've met.
The kind that gets you talking through an expression of sincere interest.
The kind of guy that will go the extra mile even when asked not to.
...you could always say that more frequently, you know?
Well then, Gil. What do you pick?
I dare you to eat this bell pepper.
Eat it! Eat it! Eat it! Eat it! Eat it! Eat it! Eat it! Eat it!
Eat it or I'll make your life impossible next week! Eat it or I'll make your life impossible next week!
*sigh* Anyways. What do you pick, Alma?
What's the most embarrassing thing that has happened to you while drunk?
I was on vacation with my family and family's friends.
We went to a hotel where a couple of salesmen tried to coerce us into buying a timeshare.
When I was sober, it was obvious bullshit.
But then I fell into their trap with the free bar.
Were it not for my brother-in-law, I'd be forever doomed to spend one week a year in Panama.
And lose my money? Forget it.
You guys go ahead. I'll have a quick smoke outside.
Jill! I told you to come in the nicest clothes you have!
...these ARE the nicest clothes I have with me.
Besides, you and Gil are in your uniforms too.
Well, I can't really show up in casual clothing. I'm being monitored.
What about the kilt you wore that one time?
I'm still surprised that one didn't break the dress code somehow.
I don't have that many clothes to begin with.
Well, everything's in place back there.
You know, there was a time when people greeted others before saying stuff like that.
Come on, Jill. Greet her properly.
Man, if that's not a sign that you need to ease up on the work, I don't know what is.
Shut up. It's become a reflex.
Wait. Alma also came in her usual attire. Why aren't you saying anything to her?
Ribbed sweaters get a free pass.
Jamie came earlier too. The dogs went with him to get some ice.
Trying to take it out of the bartending station is a chore, so it's better to buy some outside.
What were you doing back there, Alma?
I bought it three days ago.
It's amazing. It looks like just a set of wires, but you can create a frame with them.
Put the food inside it, press a button and watch as it warms the food up just like a microwave!
It's an informercial bauble, though. Really useful, but tricky to handle at the same time.
One wrong move and we'll be out of food for the night.
Everything will be scorched in a second.
So you've bought infomercial stuff too?
Haven't you? It's at the very least a good idea for gifts.
Finally, at least somebody came after me.
Is it weird that I've already heard that three times in the last hour?
Oh, don't be like that. She's not saying it out of malice or anything. She just found it funny.
You don't need to fight for me.
I'll go check the microwave wires thingy. I'm starting to get hungry.
See? That's how you greet people.
I-I'll go help Al... um... A...
Alright! We're all here, so we can start. Yo Anchorage!
I know what I said. How's the food doing?
It's doing well, but it'll take a bit.
I've used those microwave wire things before. It's either "warm nicely but slowly" or "burn that bitch".
15 minutes or so. A bell will ring when the time comes.
We need to kill some time then.
Alright, let's play Truth or Dare.
That'll make the time pass faster.
A bit late for the hello, don't you think?
Yeah. Technically, we celebrated Mega Christmas yesterday...
...but I just got a message that Dayana is making a ruckus, so I gotta leave.
Speaking of ruckus, how have you been doing?
Fine, I guess. All of this has helped keep my mind off things for a while.
I-Is it weird to feel the absence of someone you had no contact with whatsoever for the last three years?
Ask Katyusha, or any of the "old literature maidens whose spouse went to war" types.
I mean, even if you had no contact with her, maybe she was constantly on your mind.
If you tweak the circumstances, it's not that different from one of you going to a war.
Well, although the circumstances make me not want to, I've gotta go.
Oh yeah. You should take the chance and spend this time with everyone inside, don't you think?
